note.p: Buried in Old Protestant Cemetery in Macao
Career: Member of the Household of HRH Augustus Frederick, Duke of Sussex

Commanded the frigate 'Druid', which arrived off Macao, in 1840, and thence proceeded to Tongkoo Roads, a most welcome re-inforcement. He died on active service in the China Seas, after a few weeks illness.
Freemason, date and place of his initiation unknown, joined the first of two London lodges, 16 March 1832, Prince of Wales Lodge No 493, which became No 324, subsequently No 259
References: The Library and Museum of Freemasonry, ;Freemasons and the Royal Society; Alphabetical List of Fellows of the Royal Society who were Freemasons' (2010), page 19
